channel.title: ASF Jira
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [CXF-6475] problems using CXF as a JAX-RS 2.0 client
item.description:
I'm having problems establishing a secure connection using CXF/JVM defaults. Hopefully it's just a simple configuration issue. Below is the generic JAX-RS 2.0 code, along with the associated Maven dependency, and the log output demonstrating the problem. -Even though I'm specifying a "https" URL, it seems CXF is making the request via HTTP and thus yielding a 301 HTTP response code.- I'm running on JDK 7 (jdk1.7.0_51). I've tried CXF 3.0.2, 3.0.3, and 3.1.1. All yield a similar result. Running the same test with the Jersey 2.x JAX-RS client yields the correct 200 HTTP response code.

update (6/25/2015 13:29 PST): initial request indeed appears to be sent via HTTPS as show in tcpdump and tcpflow output (comments below), however reason for 301 response via CXF client stil unknown

import javax.ws.rs.client.Client;
import javax.ws.rs.client.ClientBuilder;
import javax.ws.rs.client.Invocation;
import javax.ws.rs.client.WebTarget;
import javax.ws.rs.core.Response;

import org.slf4j.Logger;
import org.slf4j.LoggerFactory;

public class TestJaxRsClient
{

private final static Logger logger = LoggerFactory.getLogger(TestJaxRsClient.class);

public static void main(String[] args)
{
try

{ Client client = ClientBuilder.newBuilder().newClient(); WebTarget target = client.target("https://quandl.com/api/v1/datasets/WIKI"); target = target.path("AAPL.csv") .queryParam("trim_start", "2013-02-04") .queryParam("trim_end", "2013-02-06") .queryParam("collapse", "daily"); logger.info( String.format("target = [%s]", target.toString()) ); Invocation.Builder builder = target.request(); Response response = builder.get(); logger.info( String.format("response status code = [%d]", response.getStatus()) ); }

catch (Exception e)

{ e.printStackTrace(); }

}

}

<dependency>
<groupId>org.apache.cxf</groupId>
<artifactId>cxf-rt-frontend-jaxws</artifactId>
<version>3.0.2</version>
</dependency>

item.summary: problems using CXF as a JAX-RS 2.0 client

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.

comments.comment:
Here are the outputs of wget and curl showing the 200 status code on HTTPS and 301 on HTTP with the same URL: https://www.quandl.com/api/v1/datasets/WIKI/AAPL.csv?trim_start=2013-02-04&trim_end=2013-02-06&collapse=daily

I also included output of requests with the query parameters reordered to show ordering of query parameters doesn't matter.

$ wget --max-redirect=0 "https://www.quandl.com/api/v1/datasets/WIKI/AAPL.csv?trim_start=2013-02-04&trim_end=2013-02-06&collapse=daily"

_Jersey (dump to file)_

$ tcpdump -w jersey_jaxrs_client.tcpdump dst host "www.quandl.com"
tcpdump: listening on enp0s3, link-type EN10MB (Ethernet), capture size 65535 bytes
^C28 packets captured
31 packets received by filter
0 packets dropped by kernel

The redirect is from "quandl.com" to "www.quandl.com". If you update the line to:

WebTarget target = client.target("https://www.quandl.com/api/v1/datasets/WIKI");

it works fine.

Note: a simple:

System.out.println(response.getHeaders());

would have shown the 301 response headers which has a Location header where it's redirecting to. A comparison of that to the URL you are building would show what the difference was.

HI Dan, nice catch ,
Hmm..., I wonder, how does it work with Jersey, Lawrence, do you use "quandl.com" or "www.quandl.com" in Jersey client code ?
Jersey may have an Auto-redirect turned on by default. CXF doesn't. The other thing you can do would be to configure the HTTP conduit to enable the auto-redirect.
Indeed, it is safer for it to be disabled by default and CXF has a good configuration support for enabling auto-redirects (with various restrictions if needed), thanks

I modified the above code slightly to yield the URI:

logger.info( String.format("target = [%s]", target.getUri().toString()) );

The produced URIs (from CXF and Jersey, respectively) appear to be exactly the same:

17:25:43.109 [main] INFO  c.m.p.cxf.jaxrs.TestJaxRsClient - target = [https://quandl.com/api/v1/datasets/WIKI/AAPL.csv?trim_start=2013-02-04&trim_end=2013-02-06&collapse=daily]

17:29:56.644 [main] INFO  c.m.p.jersey.client.TestJaxRsClient - target = [https://quandl.com/api/v1/datasets/WIKI/AAPL.csv?trim_start=2013-02-04&trim_end=2013-02-06&collapse=daily]

Thanks for that finding Daniel! I can confirm getting the 200 response now the target is "www.quandl.com".

Sergey, the test code for CXF and Jersey had identical targets of "quandl.com" on both so it must be the auto-redirect.

Thank you both for your help! I'll close the ticket now.
